column1: Place the shrimp in the work bowl of a food processor
column2: and process until the shrimp are finely ground.

column1: Set aside in a large bowl.

column2: process the ground beef to a fine grind
column3: and set aside with the shrimp.

column1: Combine the shrimp and ground beef with ginger
column9: and mix the ingredients until thoroughly combined.

column2: place a wrapper on a work surface in front of you
column3: and place a scant teaspoon of filling in the center.

column2: dampen the edges of the wrapper.

column1: Fold the dough into a half-moon shape
column3: and press and seal to remove extra air and tightly seal the edges together.

column1: It's nice to fold several small pleats in the top half of the wrapper for a traditional look before you seal in the filling
Refrigerate the filled wrappers on a parchment-lined baking sheet while you finish filling and sealing the pot stickers.
Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet with a lid over medium heat.
Place pot stickers into the hot oil
column4: and let fry until the bottoms are golden brown

column2: and pour the water over them.

column1: Cover the pan with a lid and let the dumplings steam until the water has nearly evaporated and the dumplings have begun to fry in oil again

column2: and let the pot stickers cook until all the water is evaporated and the wrapper has shrunk down tightly onto the filling
